summary: This document is an email correspondence between Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley discussing potential relocation of headquarters to Singapore due to unfavorable political conditions. The email emphasizes confidentiality and attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the sender of the email, discussing potential relocation and political issues.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the recipient of the email, responding to Epstein's inquiry about his sailboat and suggesting a move to Singapore.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are engaged in a personal correspondence discussing relocation and political matters.

keyFacts: The email discusses the potential relocation of headquarters to Singapore due to unfavorable political conditions.
The communication is marked as confidential and may be attorney-client privileged.
Epstein emphasizes the importance of confidentiality and prohibits unauthorized use or disclosure of the email.
